page.title: 08Changes in Evie
page.content: 50 years ago many people were required to work the farms, so cottages and bothies were built to house the workers. Now farms are mechanised so the number of labourers is greatly reduced. People had large families and school was well attended in winter, less so in summer since children helped on the farms. Pupils walked to school often in bare feet. The trend now is to have small families, so one school replaces 3; all children have transport provided and have lunch at school. Men often killed a seal and used it's oil rubbed into their boots and horse harnesses to protect the leather Now people wear rubber boots for work. Horses were used for all heavy work, even cows were harnessed to ploughs or carts. Now farm machinery has changed all that and cars have replaced carts.
